headline.main: DE GAULLE GAINS CONTROL IN AFRICA AS PEYROUTON GOES'; ACTION IS SURPRISE Governor General Hands in His Resignation to Rival of Giraud NOGUES EXPECTED TO GO Fighting French Leader Wins a Major Point -- Complete Unity Held Still Far Off DE GAULLE GAINS CONTROL IN AFRICA

lead_paragraph: ALGIERS, June 1 -- Marcel Peyrouton, Governor General of Algeria, resigned his post to General Charles de Gaulle tonight and became a captain of the colonial infantry. The startling shift in politics symbolized General de Gaulle's mastery of the political situation here.
abstract: de Gaulle orders Peyrouton to rept to Middle East comdr Gen Catroux in capacity as colonial infantry capt
